topic.title: Moving Partitioned Region Data to Another Member
topic.shortdesc: You can use the PartitionRegionHelper moveBucketByKey and moveData methods to explicitly move partitioned region data from one member to another.

body.p: The moveBucketByKey method moves the bucket that contains the specified key from a source member to a destination member. For example, you could use the method to move a popular product item to a new, empty member to reduce load on the source member.
See the Java API documentation for com.gemstone.gemfire.cache.partition.PartitionRegionHelper.moveBucketByKey for more details.

The moveData method moves data up to a given percentage (measured in bytes) from a source member to a destination member. For example, you could use this method to move a specified percentage of data from an overloaded member to another member to improve distribution.
See the Java API documentation for com.gemstone.gemfire.cache.partition.PartitionRegionHelper.moveData for more details.
For more information on partitioned regions and rebalancing, see Partitioned Regions.
